terms.definition: Comprehensive written materials that explain how to use, implement, or troubleshoot a product, serving as the authoritative source of product information for users.
A centralized, searchable digital platform that provides structured access to documentation, FAQs, and self-service resources for users.
Help content that is integrated directly within a product interface, providing relevant information based on the user's current location or task within the application.
A support model that enables customers to find answers and resolve issues independently without contacting customer service representatives.
The process that prospects go through from initial awareness to final purchase, typically including stages like lead generation, nurturing, and conversion.
A sales technique that involves offering complementary or related products to existing customers to increase revenue per customer.
A sales strategy that encourages customers to purchase a higher-end or more expensive version of a product they're already considering.
Frequently Asked Questions - a compilation of common questions and their answers, typically displayed prominently to reduce support inquiries.
The practice of maintaining multiple versions of documentation that correspond to different releases or versions of a product.
Modular, reusable elements in documentation platforms that can contain different types of media like text, images, videos, or interactive components.
The process of integrating external content, widgets, or entire documentation portals within another website or application using HTML code.
An HTML element that allows embedding another HTML document or web content within the current webpage, commonly used for integrating external tools or content.
The practice of running and maintaining software applications on your own servers rather than using a third-party hosting service.
Organizational containers within documentation platforms that group related content, users, and settings for easier management and access control.
Documentation that is continuously updated and maintained to remain current and relevant as products and features evolve over time.
